revised_title: The Role of Islets of Langerhans in Pancreatic Function and Diabetes
tldr: This article discusses the role of the islets of Langerhans in the pancreas and their connection to diabetes. The author reviews previous research on the structure and function of these islets, including their relationship to pancreatic secretion and the effects of various stimuli such as secretin and pilocarpine. The author also examines the debate surrounding the role of islets in diabetes, with some studies finding a connection between islet damage and the disease, while others do not. The article highlights the need for further research to understand the function of islets and their relationship to diabetes.
